channel.title: DNS not working in custom workstation
channel.description:
So, i've setup whonix gateway in KVM and then installed custom workstation (vanilla debian 10). Now from workstation i can connect to hosts from workstation using their ip address (wget 1.1.1.1 connects, but shows error after attempting to set domain to some domain name) But i can't use domain names (wget google(dot)com fails with "Name or service not known") whonixcheck reports no errors on gateway and debian workstation is configured to use 10.152.152.10 DNS in /etc/resolv.conf
Edit: Also DNS work fine on gateway, but not on workstation

item.title: DNS not working in custom workstation
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
AzazeII:

Edit: Also DNS work fine on gateway, but not on workstation

Installing external DNS resolvers risk creating privacy leaks. Search the wiki for how to use libvirt’s version safely to accomplish this instead.

Read full topic
item.source: DNS not working in custom workstation

item.title: DNS not working in custom workstation
item.dc:creator: AzazeII
item.description:
solved by installing dnsutils from bridged network interface

Read full topic

item.title: DNS not working in custom workstation
item.dc:creator: AzazeII
item.description:
So, i’ve setup whonix gateway in KVM and then installed custom workstation (vanilla debian 10).
Now from workstation i can connect to hosts from workstation using their ip address
(wget 1.1.1.1 connects, but shows error after attempting to set domain to some domain name)
But i can’t use domain names (wget google(dot)com fails with “Name or service not known”)
whonixcheck reports no errors on gateway and debian workstation is configured to use 10.152.152.10 DNS in /etc/resolv.conf

Edit: Also DNS work fine on gateway, but not on workstation
